item.title: The pothole is right at the entrance to Highwood Avenue as you come in from Shurdington Road. It is impossible to avoid as you turn into Highwood Avenue, 6th October

Flyposter at trraffic lights, heading towards GCHQ - 'French Property Show'.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please can you get the temporary traffic lights removed from the junction of manor road and runnings road cheltenham. They are not needed and are constantly holding traffic up. Second to this they keep breaking down. The junction worked perfectly fine before. The new traffic lights that have cost the tax payers money, have now not been commissioned for nearly a year so there must be a fault or the clueless installation team forgot the cables or something as stupid as. Again these are a waste of time, money and electricity. A simple roundabout would have kept the traffic moving, no hold ups and would have been far cheaper to maintain and caused less inconvenience., 6th October
item.description:
Manor road traffic lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Flytip / Cardboard Rubbish at location, 6th October
item.description:
The wooded area marked is being used by a number of vans which camp over night. There is rubbish through the woods along side the road but the location of the marked material is just at the end of the wooded section on the right hand side towards the Pylons carpark. There is a short track leading to a field gate and the rubbish is to the right of this track and into the woods. Please can it be collected up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation on path/way problem, 6th October
item.description:
As a regular footpath walker in the Pilley area it is noticed that both footpaths coming from the 11 year closed  bridge have not been cut as yet this year and are difficult to navigate.Last year 2024 they were cut excellently by presumably the GCC contractors.The previous year 2023 they were cut by a local resident from the Bridge action Group.It is also noted that gardening cleaning refuse material's ,grass cuttings this year and unwanted apples last year are being thrown  over the fence by an adjacent property in Greatfield Drive.These open PRoW footpaths are enjoyed and used by walkers. Please could you contact those responsible and action accordingly. Thank you in anticipation
Report on FixMyStreet
